info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 5 at 1:07AM CDT until April 5 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
FFWPAH
The National Weather Service in Paducah has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Butler County in southeastern Missouri... Ripley County in southeastern Missouri...
* Until 615 AM CDT.
* At 107 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Numerous roads throughout the warned area remain impassable due to high water. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding continues.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Poplar Bluff, Doniphan, Naylor, Neelyville, Qulin, Fisk, Fairdealing, Milltown, Oxly, Budapest, Harviell, Brush Arbor, Hendrickson, Gatewood, Handy, Briar and Rombauer.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 6:15 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 6:15 AM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 5 at 1:07AM CDT until April 5 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 6:15 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 6:15 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
